chapter.title: What is redBorder?
chapter.para: redBorder is an active security intelligence and absolute visibility open platform.

This platform is composed of a series of apps that provide data to the platform for analysis and active management of network security according to the configuration that was made by the redBorder user.
As can be seen later on, depending on the applications that are integrated into the platform, the user will see one of these options in the menu bar.

section.title: Basic scenario for installing redBorder
section.para: A typical basic proposed scenario for the solution consists of a set of sensors arranged in different sensitive points of the network organization, that will connect with a Manager or cluster of managers for its management and monitoring.

These points are formed by network links, called segments, which circulate sensitive traffic in which the sensor will analyze in a more or less transparent way, depending on the mode set (IPS/IDS or Flow).
For the planning of the installation of sensors, you should consider some fundamental aspects:

listitem.para: The bypass segments (specific interfaces of semi-detached networks, normally with bypass support) will intervene in the middle of traffic for analysis.
The management interfaces (in the form of bonding) for remote access as much from regular host as from the Manager.
The IPMI access interfaces for hardware remote management (SOL connection or Serial Over LAN, iKVM and ipmi commands like start, restart and shutdown).

section.para: For the Manager a specific hardware will not be necessary, the only condition is the existence of one or more network interfaces.

note.title: Note
note.para: If you have created a cluster two network interfaces are required: one for the management network (Management IP Address) and one for network synchronization (Sync IP address).

section.para: In this way it allows for the creation of a bonding for the management and connection with sensors, and another bonding (optional) for communications to other networks. Both systems support the 802.1q standard for virtual LAN (optional to the configuration time).

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: It is VERY IMPORTANT that the configuration of the Manager (or cluster of managers) is performed before configuring the sensors.

The Manager must be operational and in a network accessible to the sensors. Some of the sensor configuration processes depend on the access to the Manager.
The redBorder Manager installation scenario is the same regardless of the sensors that are installed and registered (IPS, Flow, Malware (beta) or Vault (beta) .

textobject.phrase: User interface structure of the installation program menu

caption.para: User interface structure of the installation program menu

section.para: On the left side of the screen is a list of available options. To select any of them, just enter the line where you see Selection, the number or letter corresponding to the option you want to choose.
In the case that your selected option is able to perform different options, a submenu will appear on the right side of the screen.

In the upper margin, and graphically separated from the menu and submenu, we find the area in which it should indicate the selections in the line where you see Selection and enter the commands or information that is requested to execute the relevant actions. In this space we will see the system’s date and time (UTC by default).

section.title: Selection of options
section.para: In some cases, the system displays a series of defaults. If this is the answer to a question, the default option set will be displayed in capital letters.

para.emphasis: Available options in the redBorder installer menu

listitem.para: Other options: enter the corresponding letter or command.
Exit: when you want to exit a screen to go back the initial menu, select the quit, option by typing the letter q.
Apply changes: to save the modifications performed and apply the changes, select the option apply by typing the letter a.
